titleStmt.title: A particular of the new-buildings within the bills of mortallity [sic], and without the city of London, from the year 1656 to 1677 according to the account now taken by the church-wardens of the several parishes and the old account of new houses from 1620 to 1656, and what they did amount to at one whole years value, as appears by the duplicates in the exchequer.

notesStmt.note: Place and date of publication from Wing (2nd ed.).
Imperfect: stained, creased and worn, with loss of print.
Reproduction of original in the Guildhall Library (London, England)
